Address.college_name: Higher Institute of Education and Science
Address.university_name: Instituto Superior de Educação e Ciências (ISEC Lisboa)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1991 officially recognized by Administrative Rule No. 794/91 of August 9. Evaluation and Quality Assurance Office created January 2008, and the International Relations Office and the Professional Insertion Office created 2005 and 2000 respectively. Centre for Studies and Applied Research (CEIA) created February 2010; and International Center for Studies and Research in Graphic Technologies (TGRAF) created July 2016; The Civil Protection and Safety Observatory, created December 2013; The Optometry Clinic created October 2014; and the Center for Engineering Studies, created Dec 2015. Located on the Lumiar Academic Campus

Address.university_name: Universidade de Coimbra (UC)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in Lisbon 1290, transferred to Coimbra 1308, returned to Lisbon in 14th century. Permanently established in Coimbra 1537. Reorganized 1772. Operating under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to July (1st semester September- mid-February; mid-February - July)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate and entrance examination

Address.university_name: Universidade do Porto (UPORTO)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1911, as a result of the newly implanted republican system. However, it stems, since the 18th century, from many combined experiences of training in Science, Arts and Medicine, which would lead to the future University. The university has three main sites known as Polos spreading out all over the city of Porto (Polo I – downtown; Polo II Asprela (northern Porto); Polo III Campo Alegre (western bank, river Douro) and a fourth site outside the city, in Vairão. The U.Porto is composed of 14 Organic Units of Education and Research called faculties or institutes. Their mission includes education, research and the provision of services in their specific area of competence. The University of Porto is an important driving force for economic, social, cultural and scientific development in Northern Portugal and in the country as a whole
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate and entrance examination, with admitted students requiring a score of at least 10/20

FieldsOfStudy: Traditional and Complementary Medicine and Therapy

Address.university_name: Escola Superior de Enfermagem de Coimbra (ESEnfC)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2004 as a result from the merger of Escola Superior de Enfermagem Dr. Ângelo da Fonseca (founded 1881) and Escola Superior de Enfermagem de Bissaya Barreto (founded 1971). The Nursing School of Coimbra, heir to the most ancient nursing training in Portugal, is a nationally and internationally recognised public institution due to its quality and innovation, with a recognised intervention in the health system and in the society. Its educative community is committed with the humanist, scientific, technical and cultural training of socially recognised professionals, the promotion of accredited research, the dissemination of knowledge and the provision of services

Address.university_name: Instituto Português de Administração de Marketing do Porto – IPAM - The Marketing School (IPAM Porto)

AdmissionRequirements: For Bachelor’s Degree Programmes: completion of the secondary education’s 12th grade, or equivalent and passed Institutional Admission Competition to Higher Education (Concurso Institucional de Acesso ao Ensino Superior)

Also special entry routes for: students coming from the Portuguese education system through re-admission, degree change and transfer schemes; adults aged more than 23 who have passed institutional tailor-made examinations intended to assess their ability to pursue higher education studies; holders of Intermediary or Graduate degree diplomas, students coming from foreign higher education through degree change and transfer schemes
For Master’s Degree Programme ("Mestre"): licenciado degree or equivalent corresponding to the first cycle of higher education; a foreign higher education degree awarded on completion of a first-cycle programme organized in the framework of the Bologna Process; an academic, scientific and/ or professional curriculum which is deemed by the IPAM Technical-Scientific Committee as appropriate to access the programme
